function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Complexity and variation in epidemic models, making it difficult to predict future epidemic situations accurately","Impact":"Inaccurate prediction of epidemic situations can lead to ineffective measures and increased spread of contagious diseases","Mitigation":"Standardizing and simplifying epidemic models, incorporating real-time data, and using advanced data analysis and machine learning techniques","Technologies":"Machine learning algorithms, real-time data tracking systems, data analytics platforms","People":"Epidemiologists, public health officials, policy makers","Owner":"Public health organizations, government agencies, research institutions"},{"Description":"Lack of spatiotemporal description in epidemic models","Impact":"Inability to effectively evaluate the impact of implementing epidemic prevention and control measures in different geographical locations","Mitigation":"Integrating geospatial data and mapping techniques into epidemic models, developing spatiotemporal analysis tools","Technologies":"Geospatial analysis software, geographic information systems (GIS), mapping and visualization tools","People":"Geographers, epidemiologists, public health officials","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Incorporation of asymptomatic infectors and environmental infection in dynamic transmission models","Impact":"Inaccurate estimation of disease transmission and spread, leading to underestimation of control measures and increased risk of outbreak","Mitigation":"Enhancing data collection and surveillance for asymptomatic cases and environmental factors, refining dynamic transmission models to capture a broader range of transmission scenarios","Technologies":"Advanced data collection and surveillance systems, dynamic modeling and simulation software","People":"Epidemiologists, public health officials, data scientists","Owner":"Public health organizations, research institutions"}]}
